Monster Rancher Geography
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2006 Topics (Year of the Mercury Drop): Monster Rancher Geography
By RPGDesigner on Saturday, June 3, 2006 - 10:15 pm:

I had an interesting idea the other day.

I propose a section in the database dedicated to the geographical locations in the Monster Rancher world. It's become very expansive in recent years, and many locales turn up time and time again in the games. I think it would be quite convenient if all the major locations we know of were listed.

What's your opinion on this, Lisa?

By mwmj on Saturday, June 3, 2006 - 10:38 pm:

Not that you asked my opinion but that would be a huge undertaking. Although Kudos to the person that would/will put in the man hours to do it. It would be a great addition to the site.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 10:52 am:

It sounds interesting. I doubt that more than 100 are mentioned. Most games re-use location names.

By RPGDesigner on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 12:50 pm:

Splendid. If you can give me the green light, I'll gladly contribute a great deal, and even a bit of noteworthy information on the locations.

By the way, is IMa part of the Nettle Kingdom? I understand that it's separated from the FIMBA area, but still, I'm not totally sure.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 01:21 pm:

I think more research needs to be done on that...

I know that some locales are places where tourneys are held, and some appear in descriptions of items.

There was also a world map on Tecmo's website for a long time, but it appears to have been taken down. It was the main index for their MR games area, you clicked a region to select the game you wanted info on.

By RPGDesigner on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 01:44 pm:

Let's not forget the errantry and training locales.

The major locations are pretty clear, though; FIMBA region (Nettle Kingdom), IMa region, Age Island, Marche Kingdom, Balaboa(sic) Island (Togle being the capital) and the region MRPop takes place in, Tonporo Island (Also part of Nettle Kingdom), home of the TOMBA monster association.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 04:26 pm:

The Battlecards games have a lot of regional info as well.

By RPGDesigner on Sunday, June 4, 2006 - 06:19 pm:

So, do you think it would be a good idea to add a section for this soon? You can open a thread for people to contribute, and I already have a large enough list of places to give it a good start.
